document.docAuthor: Grubbs, Scott A. & Baumann, Richard W.
document.masterDocTitle: Soyedina Ricker, 1952 (Plecoptera: Nemouridae) in the eastern Nearctic: review of species concepts, proposed morphology-based species groups, and description of a new species from North Carolina

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Soyedina Ricker, 1952 (Plecoptera: Nemouridae) in the eastern Nearctic: review of species concepts, proposed morphology-based species groups, and description of a new species from North Carolina

subSubSection.paragraph:
Nemoura vallicularia
Wu 1923:58
. Holotype ♂ (CUIC), Ithaca , ( Tompkins Co. ), New York , USA

Remarks. Adults were described and illustrated in Wu (1923) and redescribed in Grubbs (2006) . In the latter (his figs. 1–27), the epiproct and outer paraproct lobe of nine populations from seven states were illustrated with SEM and depicted little morphological variability with either structure. The SEM images shown herein from Pennsylvania ( Fig. 23 ) and Kentucky ( Fig. 24 ) likewise depicts little variability. The outer paraproct lobe was also illustrated in Needham & Claassen (1925 ; their plate 38, fig. 3) and Hitchcock (1974 , his fig. 137). The combination of the asymmetric dorsal ( Figs. 17–19, 22 ) and ventral sclerites ( Figs. 17–18 ), plus the inner epiproct member that is flanged and directed laterally, with the flange lip enlarged apically ( Figs. 18–21 ), aligns this species closely with
S. alexandria
and
S. calcarea
. The larva of
S. vallicularia
remains the only eastern species where the immature stage has been described in full (see Stewart & Stark 2002 and all references therein).

caption.paragraph:
FIGURES 9–16 .
Soyedina calcarea
. 9–14: USA, Kentucky, springhead to Wet Prong; 15–16: USA, Kentucky, tributary to Green River. 9, epiproct, ventral view, 220X; 10, epiproct, ventral view, 430X; 11, epiproct, ventral view, 950X; 12, epiproct apex, dorsal view, 700X; 13, epiproct, lateral view, 270X; 14, epiproct, caudal view, 230X; 15, outer paraproct lobe, lateral view, 200X; 16, outer paraproct lobe, lateral view, 270X. ds = dorsal sclerite, vs = ventral sclerite, im = inner member.

FIGURES 17–24 .
Soyedina vallicularia
. 17–18, 23: USA, Pennsylvania, stream into Traverse Creek; 20-21: USA, New York, Kenney Brook; 19: USA, Maryland, tributary to Trading Run; 24: USA, Kentucky, Spout Spring; 22, USA, Maryland, tributary to Fifteenmile Creek. 17, epiproct, ventral view, 138X; 18, epiproct, ventral view, 385X; 19, epiproct apex, ventral view, 1100X; 20, epiproct apex, dorsal view, 648X; 21, epiproct, lateral view, 278X; 22, epiproct, caudal view, 270X; 23, outer paraproct lobe, lateral view, 227X; 24, outer paraproct lobe, lateral view, 330X. ds = dorsal sclerite, vs = ventral sclerite, im = inner member.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Soyedina vallicularia
is the most widespread among the eastern Nearctic species, including Atlantic Canada , Appalachian Mountains, Great Lakes region, and Ohio River and upper Mississippi River basins ( Fig. 79 ).
